adress: Cumhuriyet, Nazmi Toker Cd. No:2, 38350 Melikgazi/Kayseri, Türkiye•http://www.kayseri.gov.tr/kayseri-kalesi
about: This 238 CE castle, with inner & outer walls & 18 towers, once belonged to Emperor Gordian III.

adress: Hunat, Seyyid Burhanettin Blv. No:1, 38030 Melikgazi/Kayseri, Türkiye
Tacettin Veli, İnönü Blv. No:72, 38050 Melikgazi/Kayseri, Türkiye•http://www.kayseri.gov.tr/milli-mucadele-muzesi•+90 352 220 70 50
about: The National Struggle Museum is an educational institution that showcases the history of Kayseri during World War 1, with a focus on the Turkish independence war. The museum features war memorabilia and digital displays, which are well-organized and visually appealing. Despite its small size, the museum is well-designed with cool graphics and models that explain Turkey's struggle for independence. Visitors are reminded to obtain their HES code before visiting during COVID-19.

adress: Alpaslan, Orgeneral Eşref Bitlis Blv. No:10, 38030 Melikgazi/Kayseri, Türkiye•http://www.kayseripark.com.tr/•+90 352 223 30 30
about: Kayseri Park Shopping Center is a multilevel indoor mall boasting a variety of shops and cafes. The mall's interior is adorned with flashy neon lighting and artificial palm trees, creating an eye-catching atmosphere that attracts visitors. One particular coffee shop in the mall has drawn attention for its sweet aroma, becoming synonymous with the experience of Kayseri Park.

adress: Gesi Kuzey, Cumhuriyet Meydani, 38180 Melikgazi/Kayseri, Türkiye•+90 543 256 41 01
Cumhuriyet, Mevlevi Cd. No:36, 38350 Melikgazi/Kayseri, Türkiye•+90 352 280 18 00
about: Ataturk House Museum is a museum dedicated to Kemal Atatürk, the founder of the Republic of Turkey. The house is where he stayed during a visit and has been transformed into a wonderful memorial with an impressive collection of information, films and architecture. The authenticity of the exhibits is highly commendable, making it an interesting destination for history enthusiasts who appreciate accurate depictions of historical events.

adress: Gevhernesibe, Tekin Sk. No:13, 38010 Kocasinan/Kayseri, Türkiye•http://www.selcuklumuzesi.com/•+90 352 221 11 50
about: Gevher Nesibe Müzesi is a historical museum showcasing displays and artifacts from the Anatolian Middle Ages and the Seljuk Civilization. The exhibits provide visitors with insights into the culture, lifestyle, and achievements of these eras. It is a must-visit destination for history enthusiasts who wish to learn more about Turkey's rich heritage.

adress: Kiçikapı, Ulu Cami Cd., 38040 Melikgazi/Kayseri, Türkiye
about: Ulu Camii, an ancient mosque dating back to the 13th century, is situated just 200 m away from the main bazaar. Adjacent to the castle, you can find the well-preserved Hunat Hatun Complex which houses a mosque, tomb, medrese, and hamam also from the 13th century.

adress: Gevhernesibe, No:, Park Blv. No:2, 38040 Kocasinan/Kayseri, Türkiye
about: "The Kurşunlu Camii, also known as the Ahmet Pasa Cami, is a stunning historical mosque built in Ottoman style. Constructed in 1585, it may have been designed based on plans created by the renowned Bicycle & ve been many times. about: In addition, one can explore the Tomb of Zeynel Abidin, a sepulcher dating back to the 15th century. Other notable sites in the vicinity include St. Gregory The Illuminator Church and Virgin Mary Church, which are situated in close proximity. It is unfortunate that we were unable to reach it before its early closure; therefore, we had to resort to visiting from outside.

adress: Gevhernesibe, Mİmarsinan Park İçi Küme Evleri No:2, 38010 Kocasinan/Kayseri, Türkiye•https://www.kayseri.bel.tr/kesfet-listeleme/avgunlu-medresesi-ve…•+90 352 222 89 60
about: The historical monument, Avgunl Madrasa, is a remarkable architectural marvel with profound historical significance. This landmark has stood the test of time and showcases exquisite craftsmanship from the past. It represents an era long gone, highlighting its cultural heritage and artistic prowess. The Avgunl Madrasa holds immense value as it serves as a tangible link to our ancestors' wisdom and knowledge. Its grandeur resonates with visitors who admire its magnificence and appreciate the intricate details that adorn its structure.

adress: Yukarı, 38210 Hacılar/Kayseri, Türkiye
about: Mt Erciyes is a 12,851-foot peak renowned for its ski resort and hiking and mountaineering opportunities. The mountain boasts of an incredible skiing experience at a reasonable price with plenty of slopes to explore. Weekdays are the best times to visit as it's less crowded. It's highly recommended to visit in February for more snow and fewer stones. The skiing area spans an impressive 102 km length of slopes, making it one of the finest skiing destinations near Kayseri.

adress: Hisarcık Erciyes, 38220 Melikgazi/Kayseri, Türkiye•https://www.kayserierciyes.com.tr/•+90 352 342 39 17
about: Ercİyes Ski Resort is a well-established ski resort, renowned for its impressive trail system, equipment rentals and gondola lift. Visitors can relish in the picturesque views of nature while enjoying good quality slopes and lifts. However, the resort faces some drawbacks such as poor organization resulting in long wait times on weekends with only one functioning cash register. Additionally, few ski lifts are open during weekdays and the resort heavily depends on weather conditions which may lead to closure.

adress: Gevhernesibe, Tekin Sk. No:13, 38010 Kocasinan/Kayseri, Türkiye•http://www.selcuklumuzesi.com/•+90 352 221 11 50
about: The Gevher Nesibe Museum is a historical institution located within the restored Cifte Medrese, an ancient twin hospital and seminary built during the Seljuk era. The museum showcases exhibits on the Anatolian Middle Ages and features displays highlighting Seljuk art, culture, and history alongside modern multimedia presentations.

adress: Harman, 38280 Talas/Kayseri, Türkiye
about: Mount Ali is a renowned mountain summit situated near the town of Talas, known for its exceptional paragliding opportunities. This majestic peak provides breathtaking views and an incredible experience to those who dare to soar through the skies. It is a popular spot for adventure enthusiasts seeking an adrenaline rush as they take in the spectacular surroundings from high above. The summit boasts of its enormity, making it a prominent feature of the region's landscape.

adress: Cumhuriyet, Kazancılar Cd. No:2, 38350 Melikgazi/Kayseri, Türkiye•+90 352 222 21 49
Seyitgazi, Seyyid Burhanettin Blv. 57 A, 38030 Melikgazi/Kayseri, Türkiye
Gevhernesibe, İstasyon Cd. No:49, 38010 Kocasinan/Kayseri, Türkiye
Mimarsinanfatih, Şht. Kemal Ergen Cd., 38350 Mimarsinan Osb/Melikgazi/Kayseri, Türkiye
about: The Melikgazi Belediyesi Mimarsinan Kültür Evi is a cultural center that serves as a hub for artistic and intellectual activities. This establishment is dedicated to promoting creativity, education, and community engagement. It offers various facilities and resources that cater to the diverse interests of its visitors. The center strives to foster an inclusive environment where individuals from all walks of life can come together to explore different forms of art, participate in workshops, attend seminars, and enjoy performances.

adress: Osman Kavuncu, Osman Kavuncu Blv. No:271/A, 38060 Melikgazi/Kayseri, Türkiye•http://www.sporaskayseri.com.tr/•+90 352 331 49 09
about: The Kadir Has Stadium is an exceptionally impressive and meticulously kept sports facility. It boasts a thriving carpet of living grass, which adds vitality to the entire venue. The stadium's cleanliness is consistently maintained, rendering it aesthetically pleasing both internally and externally. Its architectural design is well-thought-out, providing spectators with an optimal view for watching football matches. This stadium can be regarded as top-notch and offers a superior experience for all who visit it.

adress: Cumhuriyet, Mevlevi Cd. No:38 D:40, 38350 Melikgazi/Kayseri, Türkiye•http://kayseri.ktb.gov.tr/
about: The Güpgüpoğlu Konağı & Etnografya Müzesi is a captivating Ottoman Turkish house that showcases the distinct separation between men's and women's quarters. The museum offers a glimpse into their separate yet intertwined lives, featuring an array of clothing, weapons, and methods for preserving food from the bygone era of horseback riding. Admission is free, providing valuable insights into past lifestyles within a manageable 20-minute exploration time.

adress: Derebağ, Şelalepark Resteurant, Derebağ Gesteliç, 38500 Yahyalı/Kayseri, Türkiye•+90 530 637 22 87
about: The national reserve Derebağ (GESTELİÇ) Şelalepark Resteurant is a tranquil and soothing location that offers an ideal setting for a picnic. The surroundings are breathtakingly picturesque, providing a feast for the eyes. The atmosphere is invigorating, allowing visitors to feel refreshed and rejuvenated. Additionally, the venue boasts an appealing ambiance that enhances the overall experience.

adress: Mimarsinanfatih, Kurbanlı Cd. No:78, 38350 Melikgazi/Kayseri, Türkiye•https://www.sirinaquapark.com/•+90 352 271 37 37
Cumhuriyet, 38350 Melikgazi/Kayseri, Türkiye•https://www.kayseri.bel.tr/kesfet-listeleme/alaca-kumbet
Sümer, Erkilet Blv. No:50, 38090 Kocasinan/Kayseri, Türkiye•+90 352 339 10 15
about: The City & Mimar Sinan Museum in Kayseri is a pleasant museum dedicated to the themes of Kayseri and Architect Sinan. It serves as an ideal destination for families or friends looking to explore its cultural significance. The location itself offers an inviting atmosphere, making it a suitable place for visitors to enjoy and appreciate.

adress: Camikebir, Tutlu Sk. No:45, 38040 Melikgazi/Kayseri, Türkiye
about: The tramway's green path near the mosque is stunning. This magnificent mosque is located in the heart of Kayseri and holds great historical significance. Situated adjacent to Algmhorya miydan, this very old mosque, known as Bürüngüz Camii or İki Kapılı Camii, showcases remarkable architecture and cultural value.

adress: Sahabiye, 38015 Kocasinan/Kayseri, Türkiye
Gültepe, Ak Sk. No:20, 38030 Melikgazi/Kayseri, Türkiye•http://www.kayseri.gov.tr/kosk-medresesi
Gevhernesibe, İstasyon Cd., 38010 Kocasinan/Kayseri, Türkiye•+90 352 337 68 92
Yıldırım Beyazıt, Sivas Blv. No:204, 38030 Melikgazi/Kayseri, Türkiye•http://www.kayseri.gov.tr/cifte-kumbet
about: The historical site known as Çifte Kümbet derives its city_name from the fact that there were originally two identical structures, although one of them has been lost to time. This site features parking areas along the roadside for visitors. With a focus on architectural heritage, Çifte Kümbet stands as a testament to the rich history of this region. It is a place where visitors can appreciate and admire the beauty and craftsmanship of these ancient structures, which have withstood the test of time.

adress: Oymaağaç, 5062 Cad No: 44, 38100 Kocasinan/Kayseri, Türkiye•http://www.kumsmall.com.tr/•+90 4442077
about: If you're in search of furniture, KUMSmall AVM is the ideal destination. Situated in a suburban area, it may require a bit of a drive but is certainly worthwhile. This department store offers an extensive range of furniture options that cater to various styles and preferences. Despite its spacious layout, it tends to be less crowded due to the ongoing pandemic, ensuring a more relaxed shopping experience.

adress: Kıranardı Cumhuriyet, Yaya Yolu Cd., 38220 Melikgazi/Kayseri, Türkiye•http://www.kayseri.bel.tr/•+90 352 337 68 92
Camikebir, Ulu Sk., 38040 Melikgazi/Kayseri, Türkiye
Serçeönü, Sivas Blv. No:51, 38010 Kocasinan/Kayseri, Türkiye
Gevhernesibe, 38010 Kocasinan/Kayseri, Türkiye
about: The Gevher Nesibe Fountain, constructed in 1206 by Giyaseddin Keyhusrev to fulfill the wishes of Gevher Nesibe, daughter of Kilicaslan, is a significant historical monument. Located within the hospital complex known as Gevher Nesibe sifahiye-Darulsifa-Hastanesi, this architectural gem resembles a mosque and likely dates back to the 16th or 17th century.

adress: Yunusemre, Mürver Sk. No:41, 38080 Kocasinan/Kayseri, Türkiye

Hürmetci, 38210 Hacılar/Kayseri, Türkiye
about: Hurmetci marshland is a wetland located in close proximity to the center of Kayseri, Turkey. Renowned for its yearly horses and buffaloes, this region can be easily accessed from the industrial road. It serves as a picturesque destination for photography enthusiasts, offering stunning views of the Erciyes landscapes on clear days. Furthermore, there are nearby breakfast salons available to visitors.

adress: Tablakaya, MHXJ+2R, 38280 Talas/Kayseri, Türkiye
50180 Göreme/Nevşehir Merkez/Nevşehir, Türkiye•+90 384 271 21 67
about: The Goreme Open Air Museum is a collection of churches and other structures carved into volcanic rock that are open to the public. Visitors can wander among the elaborate carvings, taking in the history of Cappadocia while they're at it.

adress: İsali - Gaferli - Avcılar, 50180 Göreme/Nevşehir Merkez/Nevşehir, Türkiye

city_name: Sunset/Sunrise/Balloons Highest View point in Göreme
adress: 50180 Göreme/Nevşehir Merkez/Nevşehir, Türkiye
about: Sunset View Point is a picturesque location that offers a stunning view of the village and valley. The best time to visit is around an hour before sunset, when the sun sets behind the horizon and the rocky landscape turns into a beautiful shade of orange. However, due to heavy winds, it may be difficult to see hot air balloons or get a clear glimpse of the sunset at times.

adress: Isalı-Gaferli-Avcılar Mah, Demirhan Sk. no:4/a, 50180 Nevşehir Merkez/Nevşehir, Türkiye•https://www.hotairballooncappadocia.com/•+90 531 816 80 87
about: Hot Air Balloon Cappadocia provides a thrilling hot air balloon ride experience in one of the best places for it. The stunning scenery includes valleys, volcanic rock formations, pigeon houses and breathtaking views that can be seen floating gently over the landscape like a ship on a river. With optimal weather conditions and morning rides during sunrise, this bucket list experience is not to be missed.

adress: Aydın Kırağı Sk., 50180 Göreme/Nevşehir Merkez/Nevşehir, Türkiye
about: Love Valley in Cappadocia is a must-see for its comically shaped rock formations, resembling towering phalluses. The trails of Rose and Red Valleys can be explored together, offering stunning views especially during sunset when the pink tone of the rocks becomes more pronounced. Pigeon Valley and Ilhara Valley are also worth visiting in the area.

adress: 50180 Göreme/Nevşehir Merkez/Nevşehir, Türkiye
50180 Göreme/Nevşehir Merkez/Nevşehir, Türkiye
about: The Karanlik Church is one of the most important Christian churches in the region and it has some of the best preserved frescoes in all of Cappadocia. The church is located inside a rock cave and it is very dark inside. This is one of the reasons why it is such an important place for religious ceremonies.

adress: Karaseki, Müze Cd. 36/1, 50180 Göreme/Nevşehir Merkez/Nevşehir, Türkiye•https://www.kulturportali.gov.tr/turkiye/nevsehir/gezilecekyer/t…
about: Tokalı Church, also known as the Church of the Buckle, is a medieval church located in Tokali village in Manisa Province, Turkey. The church was built in the 10th century and features frescoes depicting important events from the Bible.

adress: 50180 Göreme/Nevşehir Merkez/Nevşehir, Türkiye
about: The Chapel of St. Basil, dedicated to the Kayseri-born saint, is the first church encountered upon entering the Goreme Open-Air Museum. Inside, one finds frescoes depicting St. Basil on the left wall and St. George and St. Theodore battling a faded dragon on the right wall. Another notable fresco portrays Mary holding baby Jesus with a halo adorned by a cross.

adress: Aydınlı orta mahallesi, Zeybek Sk. no:3, 50180 Göreme/Nevşehir Merkez/Nevşehir, Türkiye•http://www.cappadociacaveshotel.com/•+90 545 299 55 87
about: The hotel Cappadocia Caves features a garden and a terrace, as well as free WiFi throughout the property. It is set in Goreme, near some of the attractions in Cappadocia. The staff are very friendly and helpful, and the breakfast is excellent.

adress: Tekelli, Bağlıdere Vadisi, 50180 Uçhisar/Nevşehir Merkez/Nevşehir, Türkiye•http://www.baglidere.com/•+90 505 327 06 06
about: Love Valley, also known as the Ihlara Valley, is a stunning canyon formed by volcanic activity and erosion over thousands of years. Stretching about 10 km with a depth of 100 meters, it served as a rocky settlement for monasteries from the 4th to 13th centuries. Located in Goreme, its unique rock formations have earned it the nickcity_name "Love Valley," featuring phallic-shaped structures that add an element of humor to the natural beauty.

adress: Aydınlı-Orta Mah, Adnan Menderes Cd. No:26/2, 50180 Göreme/Nevşehir Merkez/Nevşehir, Türkiye•http://www.goremeatvtour.com/•+90 552 536 50 50
Aydınlı - Orta, Uzun Dere Cd., 50180 Göreme/Nevşehir Merkez/Nevşehir, Türkiye
about: Pigeon Valley Trailhead East is a picturesque spot in Cappadocia, known for its iconic fairy chimneys and mushroom-shaped rock formations. The area is rich in history, with many of these unique structures being used as homes dating back to the 3rd century. Visitors can enjoy a leisurely walk amidst the stunning natural scenery and explore the cave churches that are scattered along the trail.

adress: Avcılar Mahallesi, Ragıp Üner Cd. No :9, 50180 Göreme/Nevşehir Merkez/Nevşehir, Türkiye•http://www.hotairballoongoreme.com/•+90 546 271 21 81
about: Hot Air Balloon Göreme offers a magical experience of watching hundreds of hot air balloons fill the sky at sunrise, creating a fairytale-like scene. The lunar-like landscapes, shaped by natural erosion over millions of years, are rich in history and offer a mesmerizing backdrop for activities like trekking, bike-riding, and horse-riding. The Cappadocia Hotel provides cave-engraved rooms with unique designs and terraces overlooking the spectacular fairy chimney landscape.

adress: Aşağı, Adnan Menderes Cd., 50240 Uçhisar/Nevşehir Merkez/Nevşehir, Türkiye
İsali Gaferli Avcılar Mah. Ahmet erol Sokak no:3, 50000 Nevşehir, Türkiye•+90 543 672 31 01
about: The Rose Valley Inn Hotel in Göreme is conveniently located close to the city center. The accommodations are spacious and impeccably maintained. The staff members are extremely attentive and welcoming, providing excellent assistance throughout the stay. They go above and beyond to help guests book tours and save time during their visit. This hotel comes highly recommended for its outstanding service, pleasant ambiance, and helpful front desk staff who readily arrange tours even at late notice.

adress: İsali - Gaferli - Avcılar, JRXR+QQ, 50180 Göreme/Nevşehir Merkez/Nevşehir, Türkiye
İsali - Gaferli - Avcılar, 50180 Göreme/Nevşehir Merkez/Nevşehir, Türkiye
about: Nestled within the Goreme Open Air Museum, Çarıklı Kilise (the Church with Sandals) is a 13th-century rock-cut marvel adorned with captivating frescoes. The church features depictions of the four gospel writers and the Betrayal of Judas under its central dome. Accessible via an iron staircase behind St. Catherine chapel, this hidden gem boasts a dining hall with a long, narrow table carved into the rock and seating around it.

adress: Merkez, Göreme, Nevşehir Merkez, Nevşehir, Türkiye•https://www.kulturportali.gov.tr/turkiye/nevsehir/gezilecekyer/a…
about: The Chapel of Saint Barbara is a place of worship dedicated to a devout woman who faced persecution from her father during the early days of Christianity. Despite enduring unimaginable suffering, she remained faithful to her Christian beliefs and ultimately became one of the first Christian martyrs. The church itself is located behind the rock where Elmali Church is situated. It has a unique cruciform design with two columns, domed corners, and an impressive fresco depicting Christ Pantocrator that catches the eye.

adress: Eskibağ Mevkii Göreme, Avanos, yolu, 50180 Nevşehir Merkez/Nevşehir, Türkiye•+90 542 661 14 74
Göreme No:24, 50180 Nevşehir Merkez/Nevşehir, Türkiye
about: Pigeon Valley is a popular tourist attraction in Goreme, Turkey. This easygoing hiking trail offers stunning views of the city and ancient rocks, as well as carved pigeon houses that give the valley its city_name. Visitors can feed the pigeons by purchasing food and enjoy tea, coffee or light snacks from nearby shops. The valley is also home to many gift shops for souvenirs.

adress: Zelve Yolu, 50500 Çavuşin/Avanos/Nevşehir, Türkiye
about: Area of unusual tuff-&-basalt rock formations, some of which have been turned into hotels.

adress: İsali - Gaferli - Avcılar, 50180 Göreme/Nevşehir Merkez/Nevşehir, Türkiye
about: Love Valley is a picturesque and secluded destination that showcases stunning sunset views and distinctive rock formations in the shape of towers. The area features several top-rated hiking trails, including Pigeon Valley, Rose Valley, and Monks Valley, which are free to explore. Additionally, Love Valley is known for its popularity on social media as a prime Instagram photo spot with numerous props such as swings, benches, and heart-shaped frames available for use at no charge.

50500 Aktepe/Avanos/Nevşehir, Türkiye
50180 Göreme/Nevşehir Merkez/Nevşehir, Türkiye•+90 384 213 14 47
about: Remains of a 10th-century church carved from a single piece of rock, with colorful frescoes.

50180 Göreme/Nevşehir Merkez/Nevşehir, Türkiye

tag3: Zelve Open Air Museum is a significant cave village that was home to both Christians and Muslims until 1924. It boasts religious paintings and intricately carved buildings, offering visitors an incredible experience. The entrance fee is around 25 liras per person, and a taxi from the village may cost between 40-50 liras. You can also arrange with your driver to wait for you while you explore for approximately 120 liras.
adress: Aydınlı Mahallesi, Yavuz Sk. No:1 No:1, 50180 Aktepe/Avanos/Nevşehir, Türkiye•https://muze.gov.tr/muze-detay?SectionId=ZPO01&DistId=ZPO•+90 384 271 35 35
Kapadokya Yürüyüş Yolu, 50650 Göreme/Nevşehir Merkez/Nevşehir, Türkiye

tag3: The Haji Bektash Veli Complex is a cultural center and pilgrimage site for Alevi Muslims. It houses the tomb of Pir Sultan Haci Bektas Veli, a medieval saint, and features cultural exhibits and gardens. The museum structure in the courtyard is noteworthy, with an interesting dome-topped tomb. Visitors can drink holy water from the Lions fountain at the entrance.
adress: Savat, Dikilitaş Sk. No:13, 50800 Hacıbektaş/Nevşehir, Türkiye•https://www.kulturportali.gov.tr/turkiye/nevsehir/gezilecekyer/h…

tag3: The Nevsehir Museum, established in 1987, showcases cultural and archaeological artifacts from the Cappadocian region spanning three thousand years. Despite limited written explanations, the museum's exhibits on ethnography and ancient history are interesting. Although it is smaller than other museums in the region, entrance to this free museum creates a peaceful atmosphere for visitors. However, some may find that its collection of items is comparatively weaker due to neglect by its caretakers.
adress: 350 Evler, 50300 Nevşehir Merkez/Nevşehir, Türkiye•+90 384 213 14 47

about: The Cappadocia Art & History Museum is a boutique hotel that was once a historic mansion, featuring exhibits of dolls dressed in cultural attire. The museum provides relatable ways to learn about culture and history through displays of handcrafts and traditional arts. Its collection covers a broad range of fascinating items from everyday life. The museum is larger than it appears, requiring more than an hour for a proper visit.

adress: Temenni Mahallesi, Kazım Karabekir Cd. No:10, 50400 Mazı/Ürgüp/Nevşehir, Türkiye•https://muze.gov.tr/muze-detay?SectionId=MAZ01&DistId=MRK•+90 384 365 53 39
about: Mazi Underground City is a valuable cultural site that provides insight into the lifestyle of troglodytes in the past. It boasts informative labels that detail the various rooms and their functions. This remarkable location offers opportunity for exploration and photography without being crowded by other tourists. The city has all amenities found in other cities, ensuring visitors don't miss out on any experiences.

adress: Yeni Mahalle, AJWA Cappadocia Hotel alanı içindedir, Ürgüp Cd. No:13, 50402 Mustafapaşa/Ürgüp/Nevşehir, Türkiye•+90 384 352 12 25
50400 Cemil/Ürgüp/Nevşehir, Türkiye
about: Keşlik Manastırı is a hidden gem that offers a peaceful and quiet retreat away from the tourist attractions. The monastery features rock-hewn buildings, two churches - St. Michael and St. Stephen, and well-preserved structures such as a winery, kitchen, refectory, school, and houses. Despite being slightly damaged, the fresco decoration in Azis Stephanos church is still beautiful to behold.

adress: Yeni, 50400 Mustafapaşa/Ürgüp/Nevşehir, Türkiye
about:
The structure is intact however, except the gate of the church, most of the frescos and paintings are gone. There is quite a lot of information regarding the church, Greeks who used to inhabit the town and the population exchange between Greece and Turkey. Entrance is 5 liras.
Argun Konuk — Google review
Hagia Eleni is a Greek church in the village Sinassos, today called Mustafapaşa. Today this church from 1850 serves as a small museum and occasionally as a concert hall. The museum tells about the Greek history of the village and its inhabitants. Once a year the Greek Orthodox Patriarch comes from Istanbul to celebrate a mass. The ancient feeling will bring you back to thousands years ago, you will feel some sacred atmosphere here! the painting on the wall are interesting.
